lines.text: I was 15 before I realized I was dead.
You clammy slag! You sat on the KY with your fat arse!
Our school motto is Faites vos desirs realitie. Make your desires reality. I, myself, prefer the song "Don't Dream It, Be It".

[reading from book]
In those days, desires weren't allowed to become reality. So fantasy was substituted for them - films, books, pictures. They called it 'art'. But when your desires become reality, you don't need fantasy any longer, or art.
I was 15 before I realized I was dead.
And the world's your oyster, so swallow it.
Why don't you take up embroidery, Bod?
[Bod picks up the phone]
Most people would hang up the phone, she's hanging on for dear life.
[Crabs and Happy Days on the bed, Mad distracts him]
Back to work, no tea breaks.
Leave the guy alone, he's better than a vibrator and he's bigger.
I just love a man without its uniform.
Without progress life would be unbearable. Progress has taken the place of Heaven.
[laughs]
It's like pornography; better than the real thing.
[last lines]
"Come away".
This is the generation who grew up, and forgot to lead their lives.
BBC, TUC, ITV, ABC, ATV, MGM, KGB, C. of E. You name it, I bought them all... and rearranged the alphabet.
